text: Marvin Seth Goodfriend (November 6, 1950 â€“ December 5, 2019) was an American economist. He was a professor of economics at Carnegie Mellon University. He was the director of research at the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond. President Donald Trump nominated him to be Federal Reserve Board of Governors, but his nomination was soon removed.Fed Nominee Nellie Liang Withdraws From Consideration Goodfriend died at his home in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on December 5, 2019, aged 69. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American economists Category:Writers from New York City
title: Marvin Goodfriend
